column3: All of Solstice Canyon is great, but this trail in particular is for serious, well equipped hikers only.
keep your way, poison oaks and rattle snakes our of the way.go to the end , turn left and go up on right side.open the doormid top horses and hybrid zebra.interesting for families

column2: easy hike to water falls, shade, pretty flat
column3: Nice walk but it is a zoo on the weekends. Check out the famous architect Paul Williams (LAX airport, first famous African American architect of note) house - or what is left of it. This was also going to be the site of a nuclear plant - thankfully they scrapped that!

column2: Easy to moderate hike with your dog (leashed)
column3: Always busy on the weekends...Not much fun hiking with crowds.Solution: Hike on weekdays and you'll love it. Great views.Easy-slightly moderate hike.Bring your dog and keep it on a leash---They'll ticket here.Good for tourists/beginners/outa shapes
